content:
⚠️ Modified the contribution.
Comment:
Since the author is absent, I've fixed the issue with the test cases giving 100% for the naive solution of just finding the hobby with the minimum sum of injury probabilities. I've added a new test-validator pair before the n=100 one and I've edited the test for the n=100 one, so that now there are two tests and two validators that will force clashers to actually calculate the combined probability rather than just solve based on the sum.

Here's the code I used to generate new tests:
https://ato.pxeger.com/run?1=hVFLTsMwEBXbnOKpLJpEbXBbkBBqTwG7qqocMmksEjv1BwS0J2HTBRyEa3AapglU7LBk2aOZefPmvbd3G_Lnw-Ej-HJ8_XX2qbHARIhI8rtczqYjXPIVqxX4nOOuIlhyofbwlfRwRI1DrR4IiqPKhLrAk9KI8-DRqE3loY0foaCWdKH0BkZzK6NIXZgGlclzRQ4b0mSlpwIVWUqiVjABuRSrrJHta8yUxutJ5s26TC442GeWinBP8U2aREF7VUNmTr0QFgvoCNhy-yzzqiHXIXTz4iuRYM9ZifmcS1SJ7f_4mKMV6SQT016D_utMr4DyQ4fWOKfymlAae1rJG-T0Z7Gu3AQ_bslyXcOoEWsStcE76NFxgSqUZU0dpZ3dwaYDDLDvx972ydPgo4jGFmShnB4ycv6oTHC9kz-G_hr7DQ

Here's the code I used to test them:
https://ato.pxeger.com/run?1=XZGxbsIwEIbV9Z7iBFIVWpLGjksA0al7hy4dACGHGBSJ2JGTlFSIJ-lCpfah2qep7QQGPNj_3X13v2V_fus6-Tidfupq44__br4kPuFWVGVQqVUG3ETzJSTtodpDBlWWixJTBYjNmS-LXVaZBMfZDJugrHPvdmqHDNCsPr5pJbdDlDx7FwZLLEb8Jsh5cfBIGPorYj03gwcTHAMt0notvOld1_6stBZra6BaA9N3NgAhU5D2rjzIZCoajwd5Jgd4j6TtfrGuyGW5Fxq0JZOOTK7IV8F3Z3DPtcSe651i_yD5cejqNtD8uJD9g5pL7pOlKVitnV7I1s48gSXdXbrOS-4KLbRKbD65jHP0Je1G9KBAzduf6j7s9LsgIUQTZI9IJ2D2iFphdkbRVEJkMdIRRDGyMdIYCHUiBMqQmKphR06MwOTNJMKAxhgxZAxak38

Here's the code I used to create test 4 (where all hobbies have the same sum - forcing clashers to realise the sum won't work):
https://ato.pxeger.com/run?1=NZA9TsNAEIVF61M8hYIEEctEikQRQ4GoKSgRxVge40H2brI_RibOSWhSwKU4Dbt2ssXOaJ_mm33v-8f4oj8ef72rlnd_F48KOW6zxPo2NOtVQqG8viVeOWlAqZUvRp5DJcAuSKvUScs2bWm7hyFVztfZAodR3WwQMUvs0ljDucSTst4wXE0O3LHpUeuiCDfZ8Miw1HKcCgCKgB2kCvPUNA_7QQYI7nNkOEy0Z9X0oLIcIcIWn7W2DFEfPpC3RhdUSCMuShTWjrNzpR0Uv5OTjhcJqzLZemehbqK_2ldVw6OfwQww1zPMzuteJhFWTwbih7Up2UCsunLQRSfa2ynLU6TnaP8B

I've seen multiple people submitting a solution trying to minimize P(A)+P(B)+P(C), which passes all the tests, but not all validators (obviously), would be nice if there was a test that covers this case.

https://www.codingame.com/clashofcode/clash/report/4059335228af5ce471d5a31d41b04c494e1a601

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Cool! Thank you.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is great

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice problem, there should be more probability problems on clash of code. I would recommend adding more test cases where the actual probability isn't just the highest chance of an injury type occuring though, I was checking to see if you accounted for that and it only happened in the last test case.

Goal
* Please add "one or more of" after "combined chance of", to avoid the confusion mentioned by @Manuel J.

Input
* Please change "The first line of the input contains an" to "<<Line 1>>: An".

* Please change "The next n lines each contain" to "<<Next [[n]] lines>>:".

* Please add "for one hobby" after "in percentage".

* Please move "If there are multiple hobbies with the same lowest probability, output the one with the lowest index." to Output section.

Output
* Please add "one or more of" after "combined chance of".

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement.

Thanks.

Sr. when i read "The occurrence of one event does not effect the others." i assume you refer to independent events.

Independent events
If the outcome of one event does not affect the outcome of another event, you can multiply the probabilities of each event together.

and... to determine the probability of three independent event we use the formula:

 P ( A and B and C) =  P ( A ) × P ( B ) × P ( C )

the formula in your solution code works well in all cases, but i think it does not apply in this case.

because using the independence formula it does not work well
It's P(A or B or C). Just added one or more of

Yes, this really needs to be fixed. Currently only Validator 4 differentiates this edge case (naive solution thinks answer is 9, correct answer is 83). This is especially bad for Shortest mode!

Most people are getting 75% on this in clashes, and it's natural to submit when you get 100% on tests... very badly defined test cases at the moment.

Index 9:
11 33 0
 => 40.37% chance of an injury
(but sum is 44%)
Index 83:
9 22 13
 => 38.25% chance of an injury
(but sum is also 44%)

Very subtle issue at play here.
Another test case that would give the same issue would be one that includes the below two cases as the two lowest risk hobbies (amongst others):



8 40 0 => 44.80% (but sum = 48%)
5 20 24 => 42.24% (but sum = 49%)

If the author doesn't reply by the time you do (micha4w), then I will edit this clash to have a test case covering this issue.

That is exactly what happened to me. At first, I was wondering what "combination" meant: is it the "probability" term or just the sum ? Seeing that all tests passed with sum, I did not look further, then failed at 75%.
Ok, I'm fixing this issue now, since the author didn't respond. I'll write a new comment explaining my fix.
ooh.... i get you!!, yes, that's is the probability of the mutually inclusive events.
